trans-unit.source: API Management key concepts
trans-unit.target: API Management key concepts

trans-unit.source: Learn about APIs, products, roles, groups, and other API Management key concepts.
trans-unit.target: Learn about APIs, products, roles, groups, and other API Management key concepts.

trans-unit.source: How to import the definition of an API with operations in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: How to import the definition of an API with operations in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: In API Management, new APIs can be created and the operations added manually, or the API can be imported along with the operations in one step.
trans-unit.target: In API Management, new APIs can be created and the operations added manually, or the API can be imported along with the operations in one step.

trans-unit.source: APIs and their operations can be imported using the following formats.
trans-unit.target: APIs and their operations can be imported using the following formats.

trans-unit.source: WADL
trans-unit.target: WADL

trans-unit.source: Swagger
trans-unit.target: Swagger

trans-unit.source: This guide shows how create a new API and import its operations in one step.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows how create a new API and import its operations in one step.

trans-unit.source: For information on manually creating an API and adding operations, see [How to create APIs][] and [How to add operations to an API][].
trans-unit.target: For information on manually creating an API and adding operations, see [How to create APIs][] and [How to add operations to an API][].

trans-unit.source: Import an API
trans-unit.target: Import an API

trans-unit.source: APIs are created and configured in the publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: APIs are created and configured in the publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: To access the publisher portal, click **Manage** in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.
trans-unit.target: To access the publisher portal, click **Manage** in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see [Create an API Management service instance][] in the [Get started with Azure API Management][] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see [Create an API Management service instance][] in the [Get started with Azure API Management][] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Publisher portal
trans-unit.target: Publisher portal

trans-unit.source: Click **APIs** from the **API Management** menu on the left, and then click **import API**.
trans-unit.target: Click **APIs** from the **API Management** menu on the left, and then click **import API**.

trans-unit.source: Import API
trans-unit.target: Import API

trans-unit.source: The **Import API** window has three tabs that correspond to the three ways to provide the API specification.
trans-unit.target: The **Import API** window has three tabs that correspond to the three ways to provide the API specification.

trans-unit.source: **From clipboard** allows you to paste the API specification into the designated text box.
trans-unit.target: **From clipboard** allows you to paste the API specification into the designated text box.

trans-unit.source: **From file** allows you to browse to and select the file that contains the API specification.
trans-unit.target: **From file** allows you to browse to and select the file that contains the API specification.

trans-unit.source: **From URL** allows you to supply the URL to the specification for the API.
trans-unit.target: **From URL** allows you to supply the URL to the specification for the API.

trans-unit.source: Import API format
trans-unit.target: Import API format

trans-unit.source: After providing the API specification, use the radio buttons on the right to indicate the specification format.
trans-unit.target: After providing the API specification, use the radio buttons on the right to indicate the specification format.

trans-unit.source: The following formats are supported.
trans-unit.target: The following formats are supported.

trans-unit.source: WADL
trans-unit.target: WADL

trans-unit.source: Swagger
trans-unit.target: Swagger

trans-unit.source: Next, enter a **Web API URL suffix**.
trans-unit.target: Next, enter a **Web API URL suffix**.

trans-unit.source: This is appended to the base URL for your API management service.
trans-unit.target: This is appended to the base URL for your API management service.

trans-unit.source: The base URL is common for all APIs hosted on each instance of an API Management service.
trans-unit.target: The base URL is common for all APIs hosted on each instance of an API Management service.

trans-unit.source: API Management distinguishes APIs by their suffix and therefore the suffix must be unique for every API in a specific API management service instance.
trans-unit.target: API Management distinguishes APIs by their suffix and therefore the suffix must be unique for every API in a specific API management service instance.

trans-unit.source: Once all values are entered, click **Save** to create the API and the associated operations.
trans-unit.target: Once all values are entered, click **Save** to create the API and the associated operations.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] For a tutorial of importing a basic calculator API in Swagger format, see [Manage your first API in Azure API Management](api-management-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] For a tutorial of importing a basic calculator API in Swagger format, see [Manage your first API in Azure API Management](api-management-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: Export an API
trans-unit.target: Export an API

trans-unit.source: In addition to importing new APIs, you can export the definitions of your APIs from the publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: In addition to importing new APIs, you can export the definitions of your APIs from the publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: To do so, click **Export API** from the **Summary tab** of your **API**.
trans-unit.target: To do so, click **Export API** from the **Summary tab** of your **API**.

trans-unit.source: Export API
trans-unit.target: Export API

trans-unit.source: APIs can be exported using WADL or Swagger.
trans-unit.target: APIs can be exported using WADL or Swagger.

trans-unit.source: Select the desired format, click **Save**, and choose the location in which to save the file.
trans-unit.target: Select the desired format, click **Save**, and choose the location in which to save the file.

trans-unit.source: Export API format
trans-unit.target: Export API format

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Once an API is created and the operations imported, you can review and configure any additional settings, add the API to a Product, and publish it so that it is available for developers.
trans-unit.target: Once an API is created and the operations imported, you can review and configure any additional settings, add the API to a Product, and publish it so that it is available for developers.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following guides.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following guides.

trans-unit.source: How to configure API settings
trans-unit.target: How to configure API settings

trans-unit.source: How to create and publish a product
trans-unit.target: How to create and publish a product

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
